ygData.subject: Re: Blacksmithing
ygData.msgSnippet: I have been sharpening swords and daggers with success and have never used a water flask.  Is this really necessary, or were you speaking of making other items
ygData.messageBody:
I have been sharpening swords and daggers with success and have never used a
water flask. Is this really necessary, or were you speaking of making other
items for which you need ore and water? You do however, need two sharpening
stones with most swords and I had to use 3 stones with an axe. Is this what
everyone else has found?

Grod
Level 10 Paladin
Innoruk Server

-----Original Message-----
From: McConnell, Jeff [mailto:Jeff.McConnell@...]
Sent: Thursday, April 22, 1999 7:17 AM
To: 'eqpaladin@onelist.com'
Subject: [eqpaladin] Re: Blacksmithing


From: "McConnell, Jeff" <Jeff.McConnell@...>

The mixture is 1 stone, 1 rusty weapon, and one STORE bought water flask.
You are however much better off putting 15-20 practice points into smithing
and then start making files and scallers.

Silvermyst
High Elf Paladin 11th Order

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Ryan [SMTP:rwp3@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, April 21, 1999 8:29 PM
> To: eqpaladin@onelist.com
> Subject: [eqpaladin] Blacksmithing
>
> From: Ryan <rwp3@...>
>
> If I want to start blacksmithing, I was told to start on Rusty daggers. Do
> I just combineone with a sharpening stone in a forge? I tried it one and
> it told me my skill was not good enough, but when I tried it 2, 3, 4, 5,
> and 6th times it said that "those materials in those quanitites (1 dagger,
> one stone) was not enough to produce anything. Did I miss a step?
>
> Reppik
> Paladin of the 8th Order
>
>
>
